title: Disappearing bookmarks sidebar
content: Every time I open Firefox (version 109.0.1) during the first 15 minutes my bookmarks sidebar disappears on its own at some point. Why is this happening and how can I stop it? Thanks
creator: studioig3

title: I need help.
content:
Hello, I am contacting you guys in hopes of a fix of the removing the following certificate not going away despite me deleting it in certificates. When deleted it appears again when I restart Firefox. "Your browser is being managed by your organization".

Note I believe its from threat protection from NordVPN, however, I deleted NordVPN and threat protection and all the remnants with an App Shredder for this to still be here.

I am using Firefox version 109.0.1 and MacOS 13.2 (22D49) (i'm using a m1 macbook air)

I have tried manually deleting it multiple times and using the following terminal command recommended to me from someone on reddit.

(Said terminal code I tried) sudo defaults write /Library/Preferences/org.mozilla.firefox EnterprisePoliciesEnabled -bool FALSE

None of this worked. Hopefully there's a fix.
creator: striper242

title: I have chinese bookmarks in chinese charaters and cant remove them
content: I have chinese bookmarks in chinese charaters and cant remove them. Cant change them cant get rid of them.
creator: bringitom

title: After update 109.0.1 (64-bit, frequently can't open content on web pages even full screen option
content: After 109.0.1 (64-bit) update, I too frequently can't used pull down menus or fill in certain fields when making changes to an account. Also can't click on full screen function on videos. Even when I disable all ad blocker extensions, I still have the same problem. But there's no problem with any of this on my Chrome browser. I've used Firefox as my default browner for over 20 years. Now for the first time, I'm being forced to us Chrome as a default. What is in this latest update that is causing this issue?
creator: leopoldlacy

title: These pop up is malware?
content: These popup is malware? or it belong to firefox browser?

title: Firefox iOS passwords are coming up blank.
content: I used Firefox for iOS all the time on my previous iPhone. When I got a new one and downloaded it, I came across this issue. I am logged in to Firefox and all the sites I have passwords for are saved. It also asks me if I wish to save passwords. Neither of these function properly. All the passwords and usernames come up blank.
